title: Old metal type logo
content:
Original about 14 pt in size so the quality is not great. It looks so familiar but I cannot find it. I think it may have been of European origin but maybe not.

Font: 

 Rassetta NF 

Solved By: 

 [fvilanakis](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317121107/http:/typophile.com/user/176276 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Rodenstock.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317121107/http:/typophile.com/files/Rodenstock.jpg) | 403.47 KB |
author: George Thomas

comments.content:
It looks like **[Rassetta NF](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317121107/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Nick-Curtis&ffam=Rassetta%20NF%20-%20Regular&fid=e7adda0d010637fdc22a568579d2b550&fsize=60&text=Rodenstock&fit=1)** by Nick-Curtis (2005)  
From MyFonts description:

> The pattern for this graceful, subtly modulated Art Deco typeface was designed by Willard T. Sniffin for American Type Founders in the 1930s.
Thanks so much for the ID. With that information I was able to determine the original name, Rosetti.
